Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to deal with Accept-Language and Content Negotiation
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=325624130; y=MqoZr0INOFDQaJVgLeAFRKcxRmg3ur9QL3OqCO99zvas1A
X-Yahoo-Profile: nlevitt

Hello James,

You can set the accept-language header, along with any other arbitrary
header, using the "acceptHeaders" property of FetchHTTP. Currently
there's not really a way to crawl the same url with different
accept-language headers in the same crawl job, so you would have to
run a separate job for each language.
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1665 is related. If you are
doing deduplication and use the same database for the various crawl
jobs then you will avoid saving duplicate content. (The jobs would
have to run one after the other though, not simultaneously against the
same database, with the default implementation using bdb.)

Noah


On Wed, Nov 6, 2013 at 7:22 AM,  <james@...> wrote:
>
>
> Dear heritrix users
>
> Is there some experience how to deal with content negotiation triggered by
> the Accept-Language header? "Modern" sites deliver e.g. a german page if the
> sent Accept-Header prefers "de", but the page with the same URL would be
> delivered in english if the Accept-Header would have preferred "en".
>
> Is there a way to tell heritrix to crawl the sites with differen
> Accept-Language headers? In an ideal world, heritrix would only save the
> content of crawled pages if it differs at all with differen Accept-Language
> headers.
>
>
> Best regards,
> James
>
>
